designScenario.name: Landing Gear Braking System
designScenario.description: The Landing Gear Braking System is a critical subsystem responsible for decelerating the aircraft during landing, taxiing, and aborted takeoffs. It integrates friction-based braking, hydraulic actuation, and anti-skid control to ensure safe and reliable deceleration across diverse runway conditions. The system is designed to withstand extreme thermal loads, provide redundancy for fail-safe operation, and maintain compatibility with aircraft weight distribution and avionics interfaces.

details.description: The system must apply controlled braking force to all landing gear wheels proportionally to pilot input and aircraft weight distribution.
Integrate with anti-skid systems to prevent wheel lockup during low-friction runway conditions.
Dissipate 2.5 MW of thermal energy during maximum effort braking without structural degradation.
Achieve full braking torque within 0.3 seconds of hydraulic pressure application.
Maintain braking capability with 50% hydraulic system failure through redundant fluid circuits.
Implement automatic brake temperature monitoring with cockpit alerts for critical thermal thresholds.
Enable brake pad replacement within 90 minutes per wheel assembly using standard ground service equipment.
Comply with EASA CS-25 and FAA FAR Part 25 certification requirements for braking systems.

systemComponents.name: Brake Actuators
systemComponents.description: Electro-hydraulic units converting fluid pressure into mechanical clamping force on brake discs.

subComponents.name: Pressure Pistons
subComponents.description: Titanium alloy pistons transmitting hydraulic pressure to brake pads

systemComponents.name: Carbon-Ceramic Brake Discs
systemComponents.description: High-temperature composite discs providing friction surface for energy dissipation

subComponents.name: Vented Rotors
subComponents.description: Axially ventilated disc structures enhancing convective cooling

systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Control Unit
systemComponents.description: Dual-channel proportional valve system regulating brake fluid pressure

systemComponents.name: Wheel Speed Sensors
systemComponents.description: Hall-effect sensors monitoring rotational velocity for anti-skid calculations

systemComponents.name: Anti-Skid Control Unit
systemComponents.description: Digital controller modulating brake pressure based on wheel slip calculations

relationships.description: Brake actuators form an integral part of the braking system's mechanical actuation chain
Brake discs are essential friction components permanently integrated into the braking assembly
Braking system operation depends on hydraulic pressure regulation from the control unit
Integrated control interface between braking actuators and aircraft anti-skid systems
Actuators utilize speed sensor data through the aircraft's central braking computer
